name: Boerewors Braai with Tomato-Onion Relish and Garden Salad
description: Quickly grill boerewors and sweet corn on the braai, then finish with a simple tomato-onion relish and a crisp garden salad. Mild, family-friendly, and ready in 15–30 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat the OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat.
Halve the cucumber lengthwise and slice.
Tear lettuce into bite-size pieces; rinse and dry.
In a salad bowl, combine lettuce, cucumber, and cherry tomatoes.
cook_steps: Brush corn lightly with olive oil and season with a pinch of salt and black pepper.

Place boerewors and corn on the hot grill; cook boerewors 5–7 minutes per side (about 12–14 minutes total) until cooked through; grill corn 10–12 minutes, turning every few minutes until lightly charred.
While grilling, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a small pan over medium (StoveTop). Add onions and cook 3–4 minutes until softened.

Add garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant. Stir in tomatoes, a pinch of salt, black pepper, 1 teaspoon brown sugar, and 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar; simmer 3–4 minutes until slightly jammy. Adjust seasoning to taste and set aside.
Dress the salad with 2 tablespoons olive oil and 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar; season with a pinch of salt and black pepper and toss.
Rest boerewors 2 minutes, then slice into portions. Serve with grilled corn, spoon the warm tomato-onion relish over the sausage, and plate with the garden salad.
instructions: Preheat the OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat.
Halve the cucumber lengthwise and slice.
Tear lettuce into bite-size pieces; rinse and dry.
In a salad bowl, combine lettuce, cucumber, and cherry tomatoes.
Brush corn lightly with olive oil and season with a pinch of salt and black pepper.

Place boerewors and corn on the hot grill; cook boerewors 5–7 minutes per side (about 12–14 minutes total) until cooked through; grill corn 10–12 minutes, turning every few minutes until lightly charred.
While grilling, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a small pan over medium (StoveTop). Add onions and cook 3–4 minutes until softened.

Add garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant. Stir in tomatoes, a pinch of salt, black pepper, 1 teaspoon brown sugar, and 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar; simmer 3–4 minutes until slightly jammy. Adjust seasoning to taste and set aside.
Dress the salad with 2 tablespoons olive oil and 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar; season with a pinch of salt and black pepper and toss.
Rest boerewors 2 minutes, then slice into portions. Serve with grilled corn, spoon the warm tomato-onion relish over the sausage, and plate with the garden salad.
